trygit.name: Try Git
trygit.description: Use this short interactive introduction to Git to learn the fundamentals of the Git source code control system.

gitsimpleguide.name: Git - the simple guide
gitsimpleguide.description: Learn the basics of Git including workflows you'll come to rely on in your daily web development activities.

githubtraining.name: GitHub Training & Guide
githubtraining.description: Extend your understanding of Git and GitHub by reading the series of guides developed by the staff of GitHub.

githubhelloworld.name: GitHub Hello World
githubhelloworld.description: Build on your knowledge of Git and GitHub by using them to create and manage a Hello World application.

gitimmersion.name: Git Immersion
gitimmersion.description: Reinforce what you already know about Git as well as learning new techniques and workflows by using Git in this guided tour.

howtogitngithub.name: How to Use Git and GitHub
howtogitngithub.description: Gain an understanding of the basics of using source code control by learning the industrity standard tools - Git and GitHub.

ydkjsupngoing.name: You Don't Know JS: Up & Going
ydkjsupngoing.description: Learn the basics of the Javascript language to establish a firm foundation on your journey to becoming a Javascript developer.

ydkjsscope.name: You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
ydkjsscope.description: Having a thorough understanding of scopes and closures is key to being a good Javascript developer and a prerequiste before learning more advanced concepts.

ydkjsthis.name: You Don't Know JS: this & Object Prototypes
ydkjsthis.description: The concept of 'this' is one of the most confusing in Javascript. In this lesson you'll gain an understand of this and the object prototyping mechanism that make Javascript both unique and powerful.

learnhtmlcss.name: Learn to Code HTML & CSS
learnhtmlcss.description: Use this guide to learn the fundamental technologies and techniques of front end design and development using HTML and CSS.

onlineresume.name: Clone this online resume template
onlineresume.description: Practice your HTML and CSS skills by cloning an online resume template.
onlineresume.instructions: Using only HTML and CSS create a static webpage that is functionally equivalent to this online resume template.

ydkjstypes.name: You Don't Know JS: Types & Grammar
ydkjstypes.description: While Javascript is a dynamic language it is none-the-less important to understand how data is typed. In addition, it's always important to have a firm grasp of the rules, or grammar, that govern how Javascript works.

ydkjsasync.name: You Don't Know JS: Async & Performance
ydkjsasync.description: One way that modern applications achieve performance is by performing operations in parallel with one another. In this lesson you'll learn the techniques of asynchronous programming and how to benchmark and tune your applications.

ydkjses6.name: Book: You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond
ydkjses6.description: While the history of Javascript is ECMAScript 5, it's future is ECMASCript 6. Learn how to take advantage of the benefits of ES6 in your applications.

advhtmlcss.name: Learn to Code Advanced HTML & CSS

fccportfolio.name: Build FCC Personal Portfolio Webpage
fccportfolio.instructions: Complete the Portfolio project from the Frontend Certificate program on Freecodecamp.

projectspecdocs.name: Project Specification Documents
projectspecdocs.description: Learn how to read Project Specification Documents and get in the habit of including every bit of information it details that makes sense for a project in the README.md or other supporting documentation for your projects

towersofhanoi.name: Towers of Hanoi
towersofhanoi.description: Build an online Towers of Hanoi solver
towersofhanoi.instructions: Your solution should accept a tower height between 5 and 10, and then display a graphical (animated) solution, iteratively moving each piece until the puzzle is solved

createcsstemp.name: Create Webpage Template
createcsstemp.instructions: Pick a template from here and create a new template with it as your inspiration (do not use it's assets)

systematicpd1.name: How to Code: Systematic Program Design - Part 1

systematicpd2.name: How to Code: Systematic Program Design - Part 2

systematicpd3.name: How to Code: Systematic Program Design - Part 3

gulp.name: Create a Gulp Workflow
gulp.instructions: Create a Gulp script and incorporate it into your development process workflow.

fccsimon.name: Simon Game
fccsimon.description: Demonstrate your frontend webdev skills by developing your own Simon Game
fccsimon.instructions: Implement the Simon game from the Frontend Certificate program at Freecodecamp.

intromongodb.name: Introduction to MongoDB
intromongodb.description: Learn more about MongoDB using the MEAN stack.

fccbackend.name: FCC Backend Certification
fccbackend.description: The FCC Backend Certification - all projects, ignore the tutorials and just read the official docs if you want.

clonelandingpage.name: Clone Landing Page
clonelandingpage.description: Exercise your frontend webdev HTML and CSS knowledge by cloning a landing page.
clonelandingpage.instructions: Create a clone of this landing page. Be sure to create your own code ant assets

algnflowcharts.name: Algorithms and Flowcharts
algnflowcharts.description: Read this article to improve your understanding of algorithms and how to describe them using classical flowcharting techniques.

intropencil.name: Familiarize yourself with Pencil
intropencil.description: Familiarize yourself with Pencil ... start flowcharting complex portions of your code logic as part of your documentation

cloneadmintemp.name: Clone this administrative dashboard
cloneadmintemp.description: Exercise your skills by using a JS frontend library to clone a complex webpage
cloneadmintemp.instructions: Recreate this administrative dashboard using React, Angular, or Vue

thinkjava.name: Think Java - How to Think Like a Computer Scientist

classicpuzzles.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Easy
classicpuzzles.description: Complete the Easy level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles.instructions: Solve all the easy-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

codejam15q2.name: Google Code Jam Qualification Round 2
codejam15q2.description: Complete all challenges from Googles Code Jam 2015 Qualification Round 2
codejam15q2.instructions: Using Javascript complete qualification Round 2 of Google's Code Jam

clonefrontpage.name: Clone Website Front Page
clonefrontpage.description: Recreate the front page of this website
clonefrontpage.instructions: Using your own original code and assets recreate this websites front page, modifying it to highlight a different product or industry. Make special note of the secondary navigation bar at the top. Implementing that is the highlight of this project.

fccpomodoro.name: Build an Android Pomodoro Clock
fccpomodoro.description: Demonstrate your knowledge and skill by developing a Android Pomodoro clock
fccpomodoro.instructions: Build the Pomodoro project from the FCC frontend curriculum as an android app.

frisbys.name: Professor Frisby's Mostly Adequate Guide to Functional Programming

clonenetflix.name: Clone the Netflix Interface
clonenetflix.description: Put your frontend webdev skills to the test by using a frontend library to recreate a sophisticated user interface.
clonenetflix.instructions: Clone the Netflix interface using React, Angular, or Vue - pulling data from the Movie DB API or an API in a backend you create yourself.

classicpuzzles2.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Medium on CodinGame in JavaScript

codejam15r1a.name: Google Code Jam Round 1A - 2015
codejam15r1a.instructions: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1A 2015

cloneblog.name: Clone this blog template
cloneblog.instructions: Clone all pages of this blog template

es6katas.name: Complete ES6 Katas
es6katas.description: Show off your ES6 skills by completing a series of coding challenges
es6katas.instructions: Complete all coding challenges on this site using Javascript ES6.

codejam15r1b.name: Google Code Jam Round 1B - 2015
codejam15r1b.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1B 2015

buildfacebook.name: Build FaceBook Clone
buildfacebook.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Facebook clone.
buildfacebook.instructions: Build FaceBook: yes, all the functionality. See here for a list of requirements you should fullfill.

codejam15r1c.name: Google Code Jam Round 1C - 2015
codejam15r1c.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1C 2015

probability.name: Introduction to Probability - The Science of Uncertainty

12colgrid.name: CSS Grid Layout
12colgrid.description: Demonstrate advanced CSS skills by implementing a complex grid
12colgrid.instructions: Write the CSS Necessary to create your own 12 column based grid layout - see here for an example

classicpuzzles3.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Easy
classicpuzzles3.description: Complete the Hard level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles3.instructions: Solve all the hard-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

codejam15r2.name: Google Code Jam Round 2 - 2015
codejam15r2.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 2 2015

clonetwitter.name: Build Twitter Clone
clonetwitter.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Twitter clone.
clonetwitter.instructions: Build Twitter: yes, all the functionality. See here for a list of requirements you should fullfill.

codejam15r3.name: Google Code Jam Round 3 - 2015
codejam15r3.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 3 2015

classicpuzzles4.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Very Hard
classicpuzzles4.description: Complete the Hard level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles4.instructions: Solve all the very hard-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

codejam15f.name: Google Code Jam World Finals - 2015
codejam15f.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam World Finals 2015

webgame.name: Create a Web-based Game
webgame.description: Demonstrate the skills of an professional fullstack web dev by creating a game of your own design
webgame.instructions: Design, implement, test, and deploy a game that is playable on the web, using the technologies of your choice. The only criteria are that it be playable online, and that it inculde a substantial AI component.

mdconversion.name: Create Markdown Translator
mdconversion.description: Create a node module that will convert Markdown formatted text to properly formatted HTML

cloneharmony.name: Clone Learn Harmony
cloneharmony.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Learn Harmony clone.
cloneharmony.instructions: Build a Learn Harmony clone with all the functionality.

codejam15dist.name: Distributed Google Code Jam - 2015
codejam15dist.description: Exercise your knowledge of distributed applications.
codejam15dist.instructions: Complete all problems from Distributed Google Code Jam 2015

cloneslack.name: Clone Slack
cloneslack.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Slack clone.
cloneslack.instructions: Build a Slack clone the functionality should be complete to the point that one user can create a room, invite other users, and all users of that room can real-time chat. The room should be secure and inaccessible to anyone but those invited..

bootstrapfull.name: Create an NPM Module
bootstrapfull.description: Demonstrate your expertise and contribute to Open Source by creating an NPM module
bootstrapfull.instructions: Create an npm module that bootstraps a fullstack application, with Node.js on the backend, and the SPA library/framework of your choice on the frontend. Include a full test suite and comprehensive build processes. Publish it to NPM.

codejam16.name: Google Code Jam - 2016
codejam16.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam - 2016
codejam16.instructions: Complete all problems from all rounds

materialdesign.name: Extend your CSS grid framework
materialdesign.description: Enhance your CSS grid by upgrading it to follow Material Design principles
materialdesign.instructions: Extend your CSS grid framework to include the CSS and JavaScript required to implement 5 to 10 material design components

clonewebpage.name: Clone CodePen
clonewebpage.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a CodePen clone.

clonetributepage.name: Clone this Tribute Page
clonetributepage.description: Test your CSS skills by cloning this complex tribute page.
clonetributepage.instructions: Clone this Tribute Page with a topic of your choosing

cloneresume.name: Clone Online Resume
cloneresume.description: Test your advanced HTML and CSS knowledge by cloning an Online Resume

introbootstrap.name: Introduction to Bootstrap
introbootstrap.description: Learn how to use the Bootstrap Library for styling your webpages

qwbootstrap.name: Quentin Watt Bootstrap Video Series
qwbootstrap.description: Get a deeper understanding of Bootstrap's capabilities and usage

bootstraptribute.name: Bootstrap-ify your Tribute Page
bootstraptribute.description: Demonstrate your knowledge of the Bootstrap library by modifying your Tribute Page to use this library
bootstraptribute.instructions: Modify your tribute page to use Bootstrap instead of native CSS

foundationcrash.name: Foundation Framework Crash Course
foundationcrash.description: Learn the basics of the Framework library for styling your webpages

introsass.name: Introduction to Sass
introsass.description: Learn the basics of the Sass library for styling your webpages

introless.name: Introduction to Less
introless.description: Learn the basics of the Less library for styling your webpages

introstylus.name: Introduction to Stylus
introstylus.description: Learn the basics of the Stylus library for styling your webpages

howinternetworks.name: How the Internet Works
howinternetworks.description: Gain insight into the hardware and software that are the backbone of the Internet.

howwebworks.name: How the Web Works
howwebworks.description: Gain insight into the software and protocols that make up the how the World Wide Web (www).

getstartedweb.name: Getting Started with the Web
getstartedweb.description: Getting started with the Web is a concise series introducing you to the practicalities of web development. You'll set up the tools you need to construct a simple webpage and publish your own simple code.

setupwwwfolder.name: Setup Your Project Folder
setupwwwfolder.description: Learn what you should be aware of when setting up your project so you can set up a sensible file structure for your website. (Note: please skip the Javascript portion of this walkthrough for now).
